org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.utils

Class SimpleHttpConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.foggatewaylib.utils.SimpleHttpConnection

  • public class SimpleHttpConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Simplified connection management for HTTP GET/POST requests. The same SimpleHttpConnection could be used for multiple requests to the same URL.
    Author:
    Riccardo Mancini
    See Also:
    HttpURLConnection

      • SimpleHttpConnection

        public SimpleHttpConnection(java.lang.String domain,
                            java.lang.String page,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
                     throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Constructor that initializes a new request to the url built using makeUrl(String, String, boolean, Map).
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain of the web server.
        page - the page to request from the web server.
        parameters - additional GET parameters.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - refer to makeUrl(String, String, boolean, Map).
        See Also:
        makeUrl(String, String, boolean, Map)

    • Method Detail

      • setMaxReadSize

        public void setMaxReadSize(int maxReadSize)
        Sets the maximum size of the response from the server. Default is 5000000.
        Parameters:
        maxReadSize - the new maximum size in bytes.
        See Also:
        getMaxReadSize(), #readStream(InputStream), #readByteStream(InputStream)

      • getMaxReadSize

        public int getMaxReadSize()
        Gets the maximum read size (default is 5000000 bytes).
        Returns:
        the previously set maximum read size in bytes or 5000000.
        See Also:
        setMaxReadSize(int), #readStream(InputStream), #readByteStream(InputStream)

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public void setConnectionTimeout(int connectionTimeout)
        Sets the connection timeout. 0 means infinite timeout. Default is 5 seconds. Refer to URLConnection.setConnectTimeout(int) for more details.
        Parameters:
        connectionTimeout - the new connection timeout in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        URLConnection.setConnectTimeout(int), getConnectionTimeout()

      • getConnectionTimeout

        public int getConnectionTimeout()
        Gets the connection timeout. 0 means infinite timeout. Default is 5 seconds.
        Returns:
        the previously set connection timeout in milliseconds or 5000.
        See Also:
        URLConnection.getConnectTimeout(), setConnectionTimeout(int)

      • setReadTimeout

        public void setReadTimeout(int readTimeout)
        Sets the read timeout. 0 means infinite timeout. Default is 5 seconds. Refer to URLConnection.setReadTimeout(int) for more details.
        Parameters:
        readTimeout - the new read timeout in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        URLConnection.setReadTimeout(int), getReadTimeout()

      • getReadTimeout

        public int getReadTimeout()
        Gets the read timeout. 0 means infinite timeout. Default is 5 seconds.
        Returns:
        the previously set read timeout in milliseconds or 5000.
        See Also:
        URLConnection.getReadTimeout(), setReadTimeout(int)

      • setupConnection

        private void setupConnection(java.net.HttpURLConnection connection,
                             java.lang.String method)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Sets up the connection (timeouts and method).
        Parameters:
        connection - the connection
        method - the method to be used: "GET" or "POST".
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an HTTP error.
        See Also:
        get(), getBytes()

      • get

        public java.lang.String get()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Makes a GET request to the server, returning the response as a String.
        Returns:
        the response of the server as a String.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an HTTP error.
        See Also:
        setupConnection(HttpURLConnection, String), getBytes()

      • getBytes

        public byte[] getBytes()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Makes a GET request to the server, returning the response as a byte array.
        Returns:
        the response of the server as a byte array (byte[]).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an HTTP error.
        See Also:
        setupConnection(HttpURLConnection, String), get()

      • postBytes

        public java.lang.String postBytes(byte[] bytes)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Posts the given bytes to the server as a raw POST request.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to be sent.
        Returns:
        the response of the server as a String.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an HTTP error.

      • makeUrl

        private static java.net.URL makeUrl(java.lang.String domain,
                                    java.lang.String page,
                                    boolean ssl,
                                    @Nullable
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
                             throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Builds an URL from domain, page and key-value parameters. The URL is built as follows: http[s]://$domain/$page[?$key1=$val1&$key2=$val2&...&$keyN=$valN]
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain of the server.
        page - the page to request from the server.
        ssl - true if ssl should be enabled, false otherwise.
        parameters - key-value map for the parameters or null if there are no parameters.
        Returns:
        the built URL.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - refer to URL.URL(String).
        See Also:
        URL.URL(String), makeUrl(String, String, boolean)

      • makeUrl

        private static java.net.URL makeUrl(java.lang.String domain,
                                    java.lang.String page,
                                    boolean ssl)
                             throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Builds an URL from domain and page. The URL is built as follows: http[s]://$domain/$page
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain of the server.
        page - the page to request from the server.
        ssl - true if ssl should be enabled, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        the built URL.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - refer to URL.URL(String).
        See Also:
        URL.URL(String), makeUrl(String, String, boolean, Map)
